item.title: About
item.description: üå∫ Note from the Editor This is me! If you’re looking to contact me, write to me Here. üçá About # Hobart Phillips is an Australian illustrator and writer living and working in Tasmania. He’s 22 going on 23, and likes machines, midcentury architecture and Tasmania. ‚≠ï Things I Like: Thunderbirds (1965 series) Austerity Britain Tasmania Showa Japan Italian cars ‚ùå Things I Don’t Like: The C.

item.title: Intro
item.description: üéä The Epilogue of the Epoch of Rest # üå∫ Note from the Editor If you’re new to the project, start here. This is a crash course on what this website (and the project at large) is all about. Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. What is this project? # Vekllei is supposed to be an ‘epoch of rest’. It’s a project that’s become very big, with a long storyline and lots of characters, but at its heart this world is about peaceful escapism and whimsical nostalgia.

item.title: Landscape in the Age of Frustration
item.description: üå∫ Note from the Editor This article was originally published in October 2019. üëí Landscape in the Age of Frustration: Waugh‚Äôs Handful of Dust as Anti-Utopia‚Ä®# Hobart Phillips # Waugh’s A Handful of Dust has remarkable topography. The word can be extrapolated in this case in several ways; for one, the book is occupied by worldly, secular affairs, inextricably bound to a particular cultural landscape and absence of metaphysic.

item.title: Mette Sumoisnesn
item.description: Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. Mette Sumoisnesn #

item.title: Moise Hasapis
item.description: Key Article This page is about a main character in the story of Vekllei. Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. Moise ra Hasapis #

item.title: Not Long in Hong Kong
item.description: üå∫ Note from the Editor This article was originally published in October 2019. üá≠üá∞ Not Long in Hong Kong # Hobart Phillips # Hong Kong is a loud, bustling jewel of a city. It is perhaps my favourite city in the world. On sweltering days, what sounds like raindrops smack the pavement as hundreds of air-conditioning units drip liquid into the streets below. In North Point, you might as well be fifty years back in time.

item.title: People
item.description: Starred Article This article is complete. It was last updated in July 2020. Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. üìú The People of Vekllei # 1. Introduction # Vekllei language, abbreviated to just Vekllei, has six core sublanguages that are used commonly today. Although they often intersect, these different systems of communication are distinct languages in their own right, used for different purposes in different arenas of communication.

item.title: Religion
item.description: Starred Article This article is complete. It was last updated in October 2020. üåã Religion in Vekllei # Upen # 1. Introduction # Upen is the animistic, nondenominational dominant and historical religion of Vekllei.

item.title: Sundress Municipalism
item.description: Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. The Vekllei Economy # Sundress Municipalism # 1. Participatory Economics in Utopia # 1.1. Introduction # The daily functioning of the Vekllei economy is as miraculous as it is unique. Key organs and mechanisms of the Vekllei economy reality are positioned against or outright opposed against each other. And a startling series of contradictions – one after the other, each more unusual than the last.

item.title: Tzipora Desmoisnes
item.description: üå∫ Note from the Editor This page is about a main character in the story of Vekllei. Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. Starred Article This article is complete. It was last updated in October 2020. üçÅ Tzipora Desmoisnes # 1. Overview # 1.1 Introduction # Tzipora Desmoisnes (also Zelda lo Ula de Helette Desmoisnes, born May 5 2047) is a Vekllei Gregori Baby and librarian, and is the character utopia of the Petticoat Project.

item.title: Baron Desmoisnes
item.description: Key Article This page is about a main character in the story of Vekllei. Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. üçÄ Baron Desmoisnes # 1. Overview # 1.1 Introduction #

item.title: Characters
item.description: üå∫ Note from the Editor Say hi to the characters of the project! This page is an introduction to the characters of this world. See the Characters section for full articles on each person. Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. Cast of Characters # üçÅ Tzipora (Zelda) Desmoisnes # Main article: Tzipora Desmoisnes Tzipora is the main character and character utopia of this project.

item.title: Issue 1 | May 2020
item.description: üåº The Atlantic Bulletin # Issue #1 | Petticoat Bulletin from Studio MillMint | May # 2020 | Â§ßË•øÊ¥ã„Éû„Ç¨„Ç∏„É≥ is published monthly. Contributions welcome. # Contact: melonkony@icloud.com. This bulletin is 1,300 kilobytes. From the Editor # Welcome to the inaugural issue of The Atlantic, a monthly bulletin for enthusiasts and fans of the Petticoat Project, Vekllei, Tzipora and its constellation of interests and affairs.

item.title: Issue 2 | June 2020
item.description: üåº The Atlantic Bulletin # Issue #2 | Petticoat Bulletin from Studio MillMint | June # 2020 | Â§ßË•øÊ¥ã„Éû„Ç¨„Ç∏„É≥ is published monthly. Contributions welcome. # Contact: melonkony@icloud.com. This bulletin is 1,100 kilobytes. Best viewed on desktop. From the Editor # Welcome to the second issue of The Atlantic, closing a quiet month for the Petticoat Project that has ushered in several new beginnings.

item.title: Issue 3 | July 2020
item.description: üåº The Atlantic Bulletin # Issue #3 | Petticoat Bulletin from Studio MillMint | July # 2020 | Â§ßË•øÊ¥ã„Éû„Ç¨„Ç∏„É≥ is published monthly. Contributions welcome. # Contact: melonkony@icloud.com. This bulletin is 949 kilobytes. Best viewed on desktop. From the Editor # Welcome to the third issue of The Atlantic. This is the month of postcards, and feeling tired. There are fewer posts this month ‚Äî and aside from Vekllei‚Äôs Race for Inefficiency, they‚Äôve all been pretty tepid stuff.

item.title: Issue 4 | August 2020
item.description: üåº The Atlantic Bulletin # Issue #4 | Petticoat Bulletin from Studio MillMint | August # 2020 | Â§ßË•øÊ¥ã„Éû„Ç¨„Ç∏„É≥ is published monthly. Contributions welcome. # Contact: melonkony@icloud.com. This bulletin is 2,800 kilobytes. Best viewed on desktop. From the Editor # Welcome to the fourth issue of The Atlantic. Good posts this month. Bit of a smorgasbord, with stories covering all sorts of things.

item.title: Issue 5 | September 2020
item.description: üåº The Atlantic Bulletin # Issue #5 | Petticoat Bulletin from Studio MillMint | September # 2020 | Â§ßË•øÊ¥ã„Éû„Ç¨„Ç∏„É≥ is published monthly. Contributions welcome. # Contact: melonkony@icloud.com. This bulletin is 1,900 kilobytes. Best viewed on desktop. From the Editor # Welcome to the fifth issue of The Atlantic. I hope you like stories ‚Äî because this month was all about little snippets of life in Vekllei.

item.title: Issue 6 | October 2020
item.description: üåº The Atlantic Bulletin # Issue #6 | Petticoat Bulletin from Studio MillMint | October # 2020 | Â§ßË•øÊ¥ã„Éû„Ç¨„Ç∏„É≥ is published monthly. Contributions welcome. # Contact: melonkony@icloud.com. This bulletin is 645 kilobytes. Best viewed on desktop. From the Editor # Welcome to the sixth issue of The Atlantic. Big announcements, short bulletin. I‚Äôve started work on Atomic Modern, better known as ‚Äôthe Vekllei comic.

item.title: Language
item.description: üå∫ Note from the Editor Ever wondered how Vekllei people sound and talk? As it turns out, it’s something like Inuktitut blended with French, pronounced by an Australian. Starred Article This article is complete. It was last updated in November 2020. üìÉ Language in Vekllei # 1. üìÑ Introduction # Vekllei language, abbreviated to just Vekllei, has six core sublanguages that are used commonly today. Although they often intersect, these different systems of communication are distinct languages in their own right, used for different purposes in different arenas of communication.

item.title: A Cashless Tokyo
item.description: üå∫ Note from the Editor This article was originally published in December 2018. Yes, it‚Äôs painfully self-concerned and a little painful to read back, but for newcomers to the project you might find some ‚Äúobvious truths‚Äù about Vekllei you have not yet encountered. üóº A Cashless Tokyo # Hobart Phillips # I did not come to Tokyo to find a reference for the Petticoat Project, because utopia does not exist there for me.

item.title: A Vekllei Comic
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #6 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Hi everyone, “He not busy being born is busy dying,” ‚Äî that‚Äôs off a Bob Dylan bootleg. I‚Äôve just finished my thesis and I‚Äôm busy being born again. Sometimes I feel like I‚Äôm busy dying. Drawing‚Äôs been the way out for a long time now.

item.title: All That‚Äôs Solid Melts into Zelda
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #6 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. My nerves are like overused sandpaper‚Äîall dull; only the eye-catching, bizarre and grotesque can excite me now. Tanizaki JunichiroÃÑ, 1918 The wind had died and it seemed that she would follow it. Crazy shadows distorted beneath car headlights. It occurred to her in some way that, as she approached dying, she was living out the ultimate dramatic fantasy of the American misplaced girl, in the same way the townsmen were fulfilling their grotesque constellation of death by murdering women.

item.title: Petrol Heaven ‚Äî The Rohsm STR-750
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #6 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. The Rohsm STR series is a small racer built for clubs by Rohsm S.p.M., a hundred-year-old company headquartered in the Mediterranean racing culture of Tohs. Its most recent variant, the 750, is available in limited quantities to enthusiast owners and club pools.

item.title: Mittens and Metaphysic ‚Äî Product Atheism and Vekllei object-form
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #6 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Pictured above: various fashions worn by Vekllei women, showcasing heavy cold-weather dresses, simple styling, strong geometric shapes and colours, loose fits, and modest hemlines. Pictured below: postmodern neomarxism, which I‚Äôve tricked you into reading with anime. Previous posts on the Vekllei economy, if you‚Äôre new:

item.title: Atlantic Boredom
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #6 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. For a brief period of time, Zelda and Cobian took it upon themselves to make something of their youth. Cobian fancied herself a gymnast, and though this ambition arrived too late and left too soon, she was quite good at it for a while.

item.title: Baron, the Father
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #5 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. People are not sure what to make of Baron. They are not sure what to make of his daughter, Tzipora, either. To that end, they are lucky to have found each other. His obscurity is part of a severe disposition, made obvious by his astonishing disinterest in friends and hobbies.

item.title: Little Bouncy Zelda ‚Äî an animation diary
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #5 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. It’s been a week since I’ve posted. Most of that was spent drawing the same thing over and over. A painting? Please. That’s a day’s work ‚Äî maybe two. A five second loop of Tzipora jumping in and shuffling over? A week.

item.title: Memory and Death in the Flower Tundra
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #5 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. It was their first hike after Maya‚Äôs funeral. She had found adult life completely disappointing, and never moved out of home. In her last summer, she developed a desperate fascination with her receding childhood, and eventually took her own life outside of the classroom she‚Äôd studied in as a third-grade student.

item.title: Cobian and Zelda "head-over-heels"
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #5 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. make love not lore

item.title: Matchstick Girl
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #5 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Another paint-sketch ‚Äî a painting done fast. I‚Äôm trying to learn to a) paint and b) paint on an industrial scale. She‚Äôd missed the fast tram, caught a tiny splinter in her thumb, lost a button and now the match wouldn‚Äôt strike.

item.title: Road Trip
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #5 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. They showed up at the autopool, and someone had just returned a brand new AAAC Voya Voya ‚Äî incredible. It was like Christ himself had blessed them. It only (barely) seat five, and there were six of them, but it wasn‚Äôt a problem.

item.title: Uniforms in Vekllei
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #5 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. In Vekllei, uniforms are prevalent across all levels of society. They are perhaps the most obvious example of the opaque contradictions at the heart of Vekllei life, caught between wholly opposing ideas: between tradition and progress; liberty and control; and, most crucially here ‚Äî between individualism and the burden of society.

item.title: Absolute Grotesque
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #4 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. On the morning of the second day, I watched a fly crawl across the cheek of the middle-aged woman, probably an office worker, lying next to me. It moved up her cheekbone to her temple, stopping now and then to rub its front legs as though performing a ritual.

item.title: 2,000 members! WOW!
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #4 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Hello, I‚Äôm Hobart. I‚Äôve been working on this project for a while now. It doesn‚Äôt really have a purpose or an end goal ‚Äî I just want to draw and write about nice things, and I‚Äôm learning a lot on the way.

item.title: Absolute Quiet
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #4 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. There were plumes in the sky, sent from bunkers buried deep in the well of the Earth, killing with switches. Vekllei went to war, and so Tzipora went to war with it. The throbbing machinery of another world began turning, and anyone who saw the bomb would hear it.

item.title: Rural Newda in Rural Vekllei
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #4 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Newda is Vekllei‚Äôs national architectural ideology, applied flexibly in a range of modernist styles developed domestically in her architecture schools. Broadly, Newda buildings emphasise distinction from the surrounding landscape (called Dumousiantopet, or ‚Äòbeautiful and seperate‚Äô), natural decay, and honesty in material and construction.

item.title: The Thousand-Year-Old Girl
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #4 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. The concept of living forever jumps out at people uncomfortable with their own existence. There is a contemplative instinct among educated people that ‚Äî if they could simply will themselves into a state of self-actualisation ‚Äî death would only be an obstacle to greatness.

item.title: The 31st Century ‚Äî Vekllei throughout our Solar System
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #4 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. The Epoch of Rest # We‚Äôve spent a lot of time in the 21st century ‚Äî but Tzipora is biologically immortal. Where does she go from here? Well, let‚Äôs enjoy a small glimpse at that future together, by winding the clock forward one thousand years.

item.title: Meet Tzipora ‚Äî concept panel for a Vekllei comic
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #3 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Unique among girls # There are a lot of things Tzipora does differently to everybody else, and they start to make a lot more sense when you realise Tzipora either does not realise she is unusual, or does not care.

item.title: Summer House in the Azores
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #3 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. The Azores had been a possession of Vekllei since 2002, when they were leased from Portugal indefinitely. The lease was defunct by the time of Vekllei‚Äôs independence from U.K. occupation in 2015, and the new state took formal ownership over the small Atlantic islands.

item.title: Base Camp
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #3 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Just a paint-sketch. The puffin scouts set up camp not far from the rest, just outside of Krafla in the Lava region. When they moved south tomorrow, thick native grasses and trees would give way to flower-tundras and bare hills, and by Tuesday they‚Äôd be in the heart of Lava ‚Äî empty and extraterrestrial and volcanic.

item.title: Tzipora‚Äôs ‚ÄòEvery Day Carry‚Äô
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #3 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Like a lot of girls of poverty, Tzipora was very possessive of her things. No food was ever left on her plate. There was a deep anxiety that whatever wasn‚Äôt claimed would be lost. She was also naturally obsessive and material-oriented, keenly aware of the importance of objects measured by metrics in her own silly head.

item.title: The Race for Inefficiency ‚Äî Vekllei‚Äôs advocation of austerity, apathy, and playfulness as economic principles
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #3 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. This post is about the economy of Vekllei. It’s a bit of a long one. If you have any questions, just ask. Overview of the Bureau System # There are many thousands of companies busy with work in Vekllei. The vast majority of these companies are single-person shops (S.

item.title: Police in Vekllei
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #3 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. There are two regular police organs in Vekllei. Fedecenoayan porits (national police, or venopor) Comoisniyan denporitsa (local police, or cosmopor) A young venopor officer stands on the left, in the full street regalia they‚Äôre renowned for. Unlike cosmopor, they often carry machine guns while on patrol and are stationed outside of government buildings, hospitals, train stations, ports, schools and any company managed directly by a bureau, which is a trade organ of national importance.

item.title: What is This Project?
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. What is Vekllei? Hi, I‚Äôm Hobart and I write and draw Vekllei at Studio MillMint. This is a pretty complex project. Not just complex insofar as there‚Äôs a lot to read about it, but that it uses concepts and terminology you might not be familiar with if this is your first time around utopian fiction.

item.title: A Map of Vekllei ‚Äî 100 Boroughs; 100 Hearts
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Map Key Red: Magjet trains, 750km/h Yellow: Bullet trains, 300-400km/h Orange: Regional trains, <150km/h Brown: Local trains, including limited express, <100km/h Blue: National highway Dashed: Ferry line Green: tarmacadamed airport The largest division of any portion of Vekllei land is the borough; a region of varying size and population with common culture, food dependency and economic interest.

item.title: The Vekllei Crown ‚Äî coins of a moneyless country
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Vekllei, legendarily, does not use circulate currency. Goods and services are moved and offered arbitrarily, provided amply in abundance. Anything that is not abundant is manufactured and distributed directly under the control of a bureau, which is a trade organ responsible to the affairs of the country.

item.title: Village Map of Montre-Lola
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. The village of Montre-Lola is home to about 400 people in its entirety, a stone‚Äôs throw from the Aisyo borough. Each morning, however, the population swells as 300 children from tiny villages in both Aisyo and Montre take a fast tram to the Montre-Lola Area School No.

item.title: A Most Beautiful Woman
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. When Tzipora first laid eyes on Ayn, hours after her arrival in the country, she thought, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs the most beautiful woman I‚Äôve ever seen.‚Äù It wasn‚Äôt just her features or figure that captured Tzipora‚Äôs attention ‚Äî it was also her confident, inconspicuous movements and a quiet self-assuredness that seemed obvious in her gentle expression and posture.

item.title: The Oa-Class Battlecruiser
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Vekllei‚Äôs defensive military posture has, in doctrine and arms development, limited its ability to meaningfully project power outside of the Atlantic. As an island nation with a large and multifaceted naval armada, the Oa-Class Battlecruiser is the heart of her armed forces, as the flagship of her fleets.

item.title: Canal Living
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Atlantic Salmon was the best in the world, and Vekllei had a lot of it. Ocean-going fishing boats brought their haul to Ro, where they cruised wide postwar canals and unloaded tonnes of shiny, bright salmon into processing plants. If a new factory was built, so too was a canal or a railroad.

item.title: Fission Cloud at Vekllei's 50th Anniversary
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #1 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. In an unprecedented event, during Vekllei‚Äôs 50th Sea Festival since Independence in 2065, an 8 kiloton fission bomb was sunk to a depth of 150 meters and detonated at midday. It was an incredible sight on a day so clear you could see the gentle curve of the earth where it met the horizon.

item.title: Hot Rain in the Arctic Circle
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #1 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Tzipora had been ejected from the operations room once the guys arrived. She knew what was going down, anyway. No specifics. But you didn‚Äôt bring in uniformed soldiers for regular business. National Intelligence liked to work with their own people.

item.title: The Last Train Out of Ada
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #1 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. They both watched as train 416 pulled away from the platform. And that was that ‚Äî there would be no school in the morning. That was how it worked in rural Vekllei, a million miles from the automatic trains on endless timetables.

item.title: Winter Uniforms in Vekllei
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #1 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. When I paint Vekllei, I usually depict the warmer months. Hems are shorter, days are longer, and the destabilisation of the world‚Äôs climate has only benefited these arctic people. At the gift end of the Vekllei low pressure system, Scandinavian misery has become Mediterranean pleasure, with warm summers and a mild Autumn and Spring.

item.title: 2031 Apartment Diagram
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #1 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Baron had inherited the apartment from his uncle, who passed in the year following his parents. It was in a mixed residential-industrial neighbourhood, adjacent to a canvas factory. Out back was a rivulet, which roared in the long rainstorms of early April.

item.title: Announcing Tzipo-stcards
item.description: Archived from the original article here Hello everyone. Just a little update. As a way of thanking my Patrons, I‚Äôm taking some time over the next two weeks or so to create a little set of Tzipora postcards and send them out as gifts. How many cards will the set contain? I‚Äôm aiming for about six cards. How much money would you need to have forked over to get some?

item.title: Fiery Peaks
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #1 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. After three days in Ada, Tzipora set off towards Mt Miya. She made good time, and after three hours had happened upon the shoulders of the bright Volouisnesnkull Glacier. It was about here that she heard a morbid industrial siren, echoing up the valleys from far away.

item.title: The Chemical Feast
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #1 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. East of Montre, West of Tjornes, waits a rare sight among Vekllei‚Äôs hard igneous slopes ‚Äî a crown of gentle sedimentary cliffs packed with ruddy sandstone, which melt glacially into the sea chasing blue-sky bergs. Tzipora was, at the time, making her way on foot from Montre-Lola to Ada, which was a coastal town in the North-East known for its luxurious health spas.

item.title: Life in Montre-Lola
item.description: Archived from the original article here Tomorrow: 2020 Complete Guide to Vekllei Today: Up in the ro, the Vekllei flower-tundra home to spirits and people alike, green slopes and igneous monument make an ample crucible for myth and magic. Out here, there was a very keen sense of place and purpose. ‚ÄúLandscape‚Äù was neither revered nor ignored, since it did not exist here altogether. Every hill, rock and tree was taken at face value in its full honesty, with commodity dead and modernism suppressed.

item.title: The Trials of Cobian
item.description: Archived from the original article here üåº Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #1 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. According to her friends, Tzipora‚Äôs contemporary afflictions were tragic. Her medical problems; her violent childhood; her sensitivity and melancholy ‚Äî you could feel sorry for her, because a lot of her problems were not her fault. She invoked sympathy. Tzipora never considered herself particularly tragic.

item.title: The People of Vekllei‚Äôs Railway (plus Dog)
item.description: Station Dogs # I‚Äôm starting a series looking at the lives and machines of domestic Vekllei life. Vekllei National Railways, or ‚ÄòVK Rail‚Äô was the bastard of six major pre-war rail companies that were extinguished along with the society that housed them. Today there are three rail companies in Vekllei, but all of them operate under direct supervision of a Vekllei Industry Bureau ( making it Venrouiva, in other words) and are only broken up for reasons of logistics.

item.title: Carry me! >:(
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. This is Tzipora and Cobian. They have not been friends for very long but they like each other a lot. Tzipora weighs nearly 10kg less than her friend, so she gets piggy backs more often. By me! @melon.kony or r/vekllei on reddit!

item.title: 2nd Draft
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. I first saw this film at a low point in my life, and watching Shizuku discover her ability was one of the most touching things I’ve ever seen. I’m not a big fan-art guy, but I still find myself thinking about them years later and I wanted to paint them happy after the end of the film.

item.title: What is Vekllei?
item.description: Archived from the original article here Vekllei is a country in my alt-world; a utopian fever dream of googie aesthetics, participatory economics and nostalgia. Welcome to the ‚ÄòPetticoat Project‚Äô, a collection of stories about a country and a girl.¬†The concept is broken down into three sections: Author:¬†for blog posts and articles on the Petticoat Project, utopian fiction, personal news item, etc. Character:¬†for posts about Tzipora, people in her life, or otherwise events that occur during her time on Earth.

item.title: Vekllei‚Äôs Elite Military Units ‚Äî the Garden Corps and their bloody war against weeds
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. Previous post On Tuesday, two casualties were reported among Vekllei‚Äôs Folifedestarmie 24th and 25th Garden Companies in the ongoing war to make the capital‚Äôs parks the finest in the world. Michael Helen-Louisviuan cut his leg on an exposed nail during the deinstallation of old fence posts, and Ana Po cut her thumb on a rose.

item.title: Sh≈çwa memories
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. new r/worldbuilding post soon, just filling in my garbage upload schedule with generic anime and sh≈çwa nostalgia

item.title: Summer sex-ed
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. Porno is available over-the-counter at most book stores. Some industry associations attempt to limit availability to minors but generally it’s at the discretion of the shopkeeper. Often, shame and embarassment are more powerful tools than legislation in Vekllei. Generally it’s pretty traditional stuff supported by columns and fiction, although it varies between pornographers.

item.title: The Principles of "Human Decay"
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. Talking about utopia in landscape is easy ‚Äî Vekllei is a glittering midcentury paradise that fosters human life as a wonderful dream. Talking about utopia in character is much harder. How can you find utopia in flawed and sometimes unattractive human beings? By what metric is the vague, intuitive values of a utopia measured against a living person?

item.title: Hot Summers in the Arctic (and Newda architecture)
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. Previous post here. The Caf√© Resmoiones approaches its hundredth birthday as the girls outside await their fifteenth. The building was once a kindergarten, so they‚Äôd been told, but through decades of Vekllei‚Äôs irreverent planning it had become a caf√©. It was not a very good caf√©, the food was shit, but the building was nice and it was at the bottom of Lola‚Äôs steep residential hill.

item.title: Absolute Grotesque
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. Previous post here. Six bodies hung from the Rodney Creek Railroad Bridge, without names. The leftmost corpse, which was a boy, had a sign slung around his neck with tomorrow‚Äôs 8am train on it. Besides the swaying boy was his father, and next to him was his mother, and so it went down the railroad bridge, counting off his little sisters and grandmama and so on.

item.title: Much love to all of you
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon.

item.title: Catching a steam locomotive to school
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. Most of the kids pictured here are the cubs of lumberfolk who make a living out of felling hard pines in the mountains in the North of Vekllei. About half have dark hair and rounder faces, as descendants of both inuits and Scandinavians, and others are of mixed ancestry.

item.title: Meet Tzipora Desmoines, the Eternal Teen-ager and Princess of the Earth
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. This is Tzipora. She goes by two names – Tzipora, her birth name, and Zelda, a name she mistakenly thought sounded less Jewish. She lives in Lola in the Vekllei city-state. As an immigrant, she struggles with school but holds her own on in track and field, an inversion of her otherwise quiet and bookish nature.

item.title: The participatory economy of Vekllei
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. Nestled between the regional tram offices and the pre-war Ferouistet Department Store, the Lola district is not known for much but her department store and good schools. It sits on the slope of the wide Vekllei capital basin, where the Atlantic can be seen from the street. It was Tzipora’s first home in Vekllei, and it was where she lived with her father.

item.title: Dad's Birthday
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon.

item.title: The Littlest Goddess in Pachinki
item.description: Archived from the original article here üå∏ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. The Palace Gods live in decadence in an isolated and incestuous land above the mortal planes called the Palace. They do not eat and will live forever, provided they stay within the gardens of the Palace and consummate their industrial godhood occasionally with domen, an opium that they believe purifies blood.
